intro: Lithocarpus pachyphyllus var. fruticosus, commonly known as the thick-leaf stone oak, is a member of the Fagaceae family, characterized by its evergreen broad leaves and hard, woody fruits. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are thick, leathery, and glossy, with a distinctive dark green color. The fruit is a small, woody drupe that contains a single seed, typical of the genus Lithocarpus.
